Title: Construct Pen (Dock Gantries)
EnterText: Stone constructs stand in rows like patient oxen; yokes bite into gouged shoulders while a foreman stamps chits.

Options.Text: Carry crates under the foreman's eye (earn coin).
Adjust a jammed gantry (help the dock crew).
Carry a note to the Ropewalk foreman (future favor).

Description: The construct pens thrum with iron patience and the creak of brine-slick gantries.
Paragraphs: Stone-boned laborers stand yoked along the rail, chiselled faces unreadable as tides. Grease, pitch, and amber dust make a paste that darkens every groove.
A foreman in a split leather coat stamps chits and barks quotas; docklings scurry between pallets as the harbor bell marks another hour sold to the sea.
